page.title: 10Housing - Rode and Southwick
page.content: Many houses in Rode are 200-300 years old; some are designated listed buildings. New building is strictly limited and extending the boundaries of the villages is forbidden. All new houses must have garage or parking space. 3-bedroomed semi-detached modern houses range from Â£30-35,000 and older houses Â£40-65,000. Even derelict properties attract high pricesand there are several houses for sale at over Â£100,000. Building land costs Â£40-60,000 an acre. Most houses are owner-occupied but there is some council accomodation, especially for the elderly. Southwick is twice as large as Rode and has closer links with Trowbridge. Similar properties tend to be at least Â£5,000 cheaper. There is also much more council housing and large modern housing estates.
